definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The instantmessaging feature appears to be one part of Microsoft's response.
sentences.chinese: 即時通服務似乎是微軟對此舉動作出迴應的一部分。

sentences.english: The move puts the brakes on efforts to improve relations between the two countries' defense establishments.
sentences.chinese: 這一舉動令改善中美兩軍關係的努力暫停。

sentences.english: It's a gutsy move to wear ugly clothes.'
sentences.chinese: 穿醜服裝是個勇敢的舉動。

sentences.english: It is hoped the move will boost research into neglected diseases.
sentences.chinese: 人們希望這一舉動將推進被忽視疾病的研究。

sentences.english: For human-rights activists and sympathizers of the Dalai Lama in Western countries, their actions can be called a failure.
sentences.chinese: 人權份子和西方噠賴的同情者們的舉動是失敗的。

sentences.english: The researchers studied the behaviour of female brown capuchin monkeys.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員研究了雌性僧帽猴的行爲舉動。

sentences.english: And, you know, I don't glorify any kind of misbehavior or misuse of anything.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你知道，我不會美化任何不當的舉動。

sentences.english: Joshi's proposed shift significantly moves the economic goalposts for digital print.
sentences.chinese: 喬希提出的舉動明顯轉變經濟球門柱的數碼印刷。

sentences.english: After the sun followed watching him.
sentences.chinese: 之後，孫磊尾隨着監視他的舉動。

sentences.english: It seemed as if the starlings had been hypnotised because they acted as if they were not being chased.
sentences.chinese: 椋鳥看似精神恍惚，因此它們的舉動像沒人追趕一樣。

sentences.english: His son seemed to be taking his father's oddness very pleasantly.
sentences.chinese: 他的兒子似乎對他父親奇怪的舉動感到愉快。

sentences.english: That such efforts are needed is at first sight odd.
sentences.chinese: 這種舉動的必要性初看有點古怪。

sentences.english: What we do in Yenan is bound to influence the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 延安的舉動，不能不影響全國。

sentences.english: Shusheng swerved the car to the left and that swerve saved his life.
sentences.chinese: 書生突然把車向左轉，而這一舉動挽救了他的性命。

sentences.english: Of course, there are also some positive aspects to the new eMusic.
sentences.chinese: 當然，eMusic的這一舉動也有積極的一面。

sentences.english: Such a profit-driven move has also aroused a controversy.
sentences.chinese: 同時，如此一個利益薰心的舉動也引起了一片爭議聲。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
